event.title: 1852, Josefa Tellez, owner of a small farm in the vicinity of the area where the town of San Lorenzo is located

data.event: Back in 1852, Josefa Tellez, owner of a small farm in the vicinity of the area where the town of San Lorenzo is located today, found a religious image of San Lorenzo.
Back in 1852, Josefa Tellez, owner of a small farm in the vicinity of the area where the town of San Lorenzo is located today, found a religious image of San Lorenzo.

event.title: that day the place was known

data.event: From that day the place was known as San Lorenzo de los Tellez in honor to Josefa Tellez.

event.title: was officially granted the title of town on August 23, 1858

data.event: San Lorenzo was officially granted the title of town on August 23, 1858.
With new settlers from Granada Department in 1872, the town became more populated.
The municipality of San Lorenzo was part of the Chontales Department until 1935, when it became part of the Boaco Department.
